name: places/ChIJ-bbj2YtZwokRx7Ps7y536n8
formattedAddress: 40 Mercer St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 40 Mercer St, New York, NY 10013-3076, USA

originalText.text: My friends and I had a great experience here! The entire staff was welcoming and super helpful, especially Violet. She even text messaged me letting me know that she can order things for me, since I am in a different state. Pretty good selection and a slamming sale going on. Love the sweaters and casual wear.

text.text: My friends and I had a great experience here! The entire staff was welcoming and super helpful, especially Violet. She even text messaged me letting me know that she can order things for me, since I am in a different state. Pretty good selection and a slamming sale going on. Love the sweaters and casual wear.

originalText.text:
I love Ganni the brand and their clothes but customer service is definitely not their cup of tea.

I bought a pair of 400 dollar shoes at their store in Williamsburg but ended up wanting to exchange them at this Soho location.
They informed me the shoe was non-returnable because I had been given 10 percent off. I asked for an exchange, and they said I would have to return to the original store of purchase to exchange it even though I specifically went out of my way to go to the Soho location (I don't live near either store).

They were unapologetic and unwilling to accommodate. When I finally went to the Williamsburg store the next day to exchange, they gave me the cold shoulder and acted really tense towards me.

This should not be how someone is treated after I spent about 600 bucks at their store during my initial visit. If someone wants to exchange or return something they should not be treated like this. I'm a loyal Ganni fan but they've lost me after this.

originalText.text: I am pretty sure one of the employees "read" me and was slyly insulting to me when I was at the store the other day. I was in the store to look at a leather tote I had seen online, as I want a new one for work. The tote was a nice leather tote around $300. It was clear what kind of product I was looking for. The bag didn't work out because the straps weren't long enough and I wanted to be able to wear it crossbody. The employee said, "I am not supposed to do this, but have you tried BAGGU." I was pretty sure I knew what kind of bags BAGGU sold but I thought maybe I was mistaken since she was sending me there. So I went over to BAGGU and it was of course a bunch of gross mom bags with ugly patterns. I think she sent me there to be insulting, she didn't try to show me another bag or sell anything else to me. I ended up making a purchase at Kate Spade where the staff was more than helpful.

originalText.text: Had a lovely experience here looking for plus size clothes! We brought my mother in law here to look for dresses and the people working the floor were so incredibly sweet and pulled out all the stops to help her find something she loved. We left having placed an order for a gorgeous dress in her size and a beautiful coat, which the manager offered to ship to her home in Texas.

originalText.text: Extremely overpriced shoes (they only look good) I’ve had so much pain wearing them, the leather inside is so tough , after 10 min of walking these shoes will scratched your skin till blood! Tried to wear them 4 times it did not get better now $500 shoes goes to garbage  (sorry for the graphic photo)
